Legal_Issue: Failure to assess related experience and breach of duty of fairness
Application_Facts: Applicant has 20 years of experience in the garment industry; visa officer assessed zero units for experience without exploring transferable skills or job components; applicant faced language difficulties
Decision_Outcome: Visa denied due to perceived lack of relevant experience as a production line manager
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review under Federal Court Act
Court_Ruling: Motion allowed; decision quashed; case remanded for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Visa officer failed to properly assess work experience and did not fulfill duty of procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Claim: Error in law and breach of fairness in assessment of experience
Legal_Standard: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
Assessment_Factor: Work experience, transferable skills, job component analysis
Procedural_Issue: Lack of meaningful engagement with applicant's work history due to language barriers
Evidence_Used: Job responsibilities as production line manager
Relief_Sought: Quashing of decision and re-assessment by new visa officer
Governing_Rule: Visa officers must fairly assess applicants' experience and consider related work history
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Officer did not request clarification or breakdown of job duties despite language challenges
Outcome: Decision set aside, application to be reconsidered
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of visa opportunity due to inadequate evaluation
Cause_Description: Applicant's visa was denied due to perceived lack of relevant experience as a production line manager
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient inquiry into applicant's documented work history
Evidence_Issues: Failure to probe transferable skills despite available experience
Decision_Rationale: Officer erred in law by not considering relevant experience and breaching duty of fairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of detailed questioning on job components and transferable skills
Legal_Standard_Applied: Duty of fairness in administrative immigration decisions
